pages.title: Research topics
body: If you are interested in doing a PhD or a MSc in one of the following topics, please contact me.
## Programming Languages
I'm interested in all topics related to programming languages, especially those pertaining the correctness
of software using lightweight techniques like type systems. Sophisticated languages like RUST, OCaml, or Haskell
have characteristics that help developers write correct software. I'm interested in exploring these characteristics
and pushing them further by using techniques like dependent types, refinement types, and type-level programming.
## Live Programming
The evolution of software is a complex task. Developers need to understand the code they are changing, and the impact
of their changes. Live programming is a paradigm that aims to help developers in this task by providing immediate feedback
on the impact of their changes. I'm interested in exploring this paradigm in the context of web applications.
## Automated Software Engineering and Software Evolution
Software is not static. It evolves over time. I'm interested in exploring techniques that help developers evolve their
software. I'm particularly interested in techniques that help developers evolve their software safely.
## Frontiers between Business process languages and Data
Business process languages are used to describe the flow of data in an organization. However, processes, data and code live in different worlds.
I'm interested in exploring techniques that help developers join these worlds.
## Software Security
I've been working on software security for the last 10 years. I'm interested in making software secure by construction.
## Concurrency and Distribution
## Low-code platforms
I have been working with the OutSystems research team for the last 14 years and the topic of low-code languages
and lightweight abstraction mechanims is one interesting topic for me.
